TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UserTrackingRecord extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingRecord

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains the data sent to a tracking service by the runtime tracking infrastructure when a is matched.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingProfile>, it sends a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord> to the tracking service over the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingChannel> associated with that tracking service. The tracking service can perform whatever action is required on the data in the tracking record.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The constructor is called by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of annotations associated with the user event.
Docs.value: A that contains the annotations that are associated with the user event by the that was matched in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can specify annotations to be associated with a user event in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Annotations%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. When the runtime tracking infrastructure matches the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint>, it returns these annotations in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Annotations%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.
## Examples For more information about annotations, see the [Tracking Profile Designer Sample](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-3.5/ms742004(v=vs.90)) and the [Using the Tracking Profile Object Model Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0b820e0a-8f4b-4276-8452-e985b51d9528).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> Body { get; }

Public ReadOnly Property Body As IList(Of TrackingDataItem)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Workflow::Runtime::Tracking::TrackingDataItem ^> ^ Body { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::Workflow::Runtime::Tracking::TrackingDataItem ^> ^ get(); };
member this.Body : System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem>

Docs.summary: Gets a list containing any additional data extracted from the workflow for the that was matched.
Docs.value: A list of objects each of which contains a single piece of extracted data and its associated annotations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> is matched, the runtime tracking infrastructure can extract data from the workflow instance. The data to be extracted is specified by <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Extracts%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint.Extracts%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> can contain <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.ActivityDataTrackingExtract> objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the activity associated with the user event, and <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.WorkflowDataTrackingExtract> objects, which specify member data to be extracted from the root activity of the workflow. Each type of extract can also specify annotations to be returned with the extracted data. The runtime tracking infrastructure encapsulates each piece of extracted data and its associated annotations in a <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> which it adds to <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Body%2A>.
Because the user data pushed to the tracking service by the user event is contained in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserData%2A>, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Body%2A> will frequently be an empty list. This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

public: virtual property EventArgs ^ EventArgs { EventArgs ^ get(); void set(EventArgs ^ value); };
member this.EventArgs : EventArgs with get, set

Docs.summary: Always a null reference ( in Visual Basic) for a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks There is no event data associated with a user event, therefore, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.EventArgs%2A> has no meaning and is always a null reference (`Nothing`).
The user data that is pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%2A> methods that caused the user event is sent in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserData%2A>. Any data extracts that are associated with the user event by the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> are encapsulated in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.TrackingDataItem> objects and sent in <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.Body%2A>.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.DateTime> is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the order of the user event that matched the in the workflow instance.
Docs.value: A value that indicates the order of the user event in the workflow instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.EventOrder%2A> indicates the order of the user event that matched the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackPoint> relative to the other tracking events emitted by the workflow instance. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.EventOrder%2A> will be unique within a workflow instance, but it is not guaranteed to be sequential.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the user data for this user event.
Docs.value: The user data for which the was created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserData%2A> contains the actual data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure by whichever one of the overloaded <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%2A> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%2A> methods is responsible for the user event.
This property is set by the runtime tracking infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: public string UserDataKey { get; set; }
.property instance string UserDataKey
Public Property UserDataKey As String
public: property System::String ^ UserDataKey { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.UserDataKey : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a key associated with the user data for this .
Docs.value: A key associated with the user data for this tracking record.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An activity or workflow designer can use either <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.ActivityExecutionContext.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity.TrackData%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> to specify a key to associate with the user data pushed to the runtime tracking infrastructure. <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserDataKey%2A> contains this key. If no key is specified, <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.UserTrackingRecord.UserDataKey%2A> is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
